description: Anonymous. Fols. 117; 24 x 16.5 cm.; written surface 16.8 x 12.5 cm.; 17 lines to page; on glazed Arabic paper; in naskhi; with vowel signs; entries in red. A collection of the tales of the prophets. Beg.: باب في ذکر بختنصر وخبر شعىا وارمىا ودانىال. Ending: ازال الدهر ملکهم واضحى * ىنقّل من اناس الى اناس Marginal notes and glosses. First six folios by later hand and on European paper. On three folios following last is a discussion of the tale of the army of the elephant (see Sūrah CV) entitled Majlis fī Qiṣṣat Aṣḥāb al-Fīl. This is dated A.H. 1145 [A.D. 1733]. MS in good condition but worm-eaten; Arabic binding with flap; blind stamped and tooling. Probably from XVth century. Acquired from Bārūdī, Beirūt, A.D. 1925.
title: Qiṣaṣ al-anbiyāʼ.
subject: Prophets, Pre-Islamic—Early works to 1800
member_of_collections: Princeton Digital Library of Islamic Manuscripts
